0.question: Show me about the distribution of date_address_to and the amount of date_address_to, and group by attribute other_details and bin date_address_to by month in a bar chart.
0.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from datetime import datetime

df = pd.read_csv('./visEval_dataset/databases/behavior_monitoring/student_addresses.csv')

df['date_address_to'] = pd.to_datetime(df['date_address_to'])
df['month_year'] = df['date_address_to'].dt.to_period('M')
grouped_df = df.groupby(['month_year', 'other_details']).size().unstack()

fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=(10, 4))
grouped_df.plot(kind='bar', ax=ax)

ax.set_xlabel("Month-Year")
ax.set_ylabel("Number of Addresses")
ax.set_title("Distribution and Count of 'date_address_to' by Month and Other Details")
plt.suptitle("")
plt.show()
0.addRule: If chart has enough space, rotate xtick to 0 using "plt.xticks(rotation=0)"

0.question: Show me about the distribution of date_address_to and the sum of monthly_rental, and group by attribute other_details and bin date_address_to by month in a bar chart.
0.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
df = pd.read_csv('./visEval_dataset/databases/behavior_monitoring/student_addresses.csv', parse_dates=['date_address_to'])

df['year_month'] = df['date_address_to'].dt.to_period('M')
monthly_rental_sum = df.groupby(['other_details', 'year_month'])['monthly_rental'].sum().unstack()

fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=(10, 4))
monthly_rental_sum.plot(kind='bar', ax=ax)
ax.set_title('Distribution of Date Address To and Sum of Monthly Rental')
ax.set_xlabel('Month')
ax.set_ylabel('Sum of Monthly Rental')
fig.suptitle('')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

0.question: Give me the comparison about the average of monthly_rental over the  date_address_to , and group by attribute other_details and bin date_address_to by month by a bar chart.
0.evaluation: Rotated x-axis; Used key as legend name, not the specific data meaning
0.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv('./visEval_dataset/databases/behavior_monitoring/student_addresses.csv')
df['date_address_to'] = pd.to_datetime(df['date_address_to'])
df['month'] = df['date_address_to'].dt.to_period('M')
grouped = df.groupby(['month', 'other_details'])['monthly_rental'].mean().unstack()

fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=(10, 4))
grouped.plot(kind='bar', ax=ax)
ax.spines['top'].set_visible(False)
ax.spines['right'].set_visible(False)
ax.set_xlabel('Month')
ax.set_ylabel('Average Monthly Rental')
ax.set_title('Average Monthly Rental Comparison by Property Type')
plt.suptitle('')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
0.addRule: If you know the specific data meaning of the column name, use the meaning as legend name

0.question: A bar chart shows the distribution of  date_address_from and the amount of date_address_from , and group by attribute other_details and bin date_address_from by year.
0.evaluation: X-axis label overflowed. Missing part of X-axis data (2018) because of "ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(mdates.YearLocator())"
0.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.dates as mdates

df = pd.read_csv('./visEval_dataset/databases/behavior_monitoring/Student_Addresses.csv')
df['date_address_from'] = pd.to_datetime(df['date_address_from'])
df['year'] = df['date_address_from'].dt.year

df_grouped = df.groupby(['year', 'other_details']).size().unstack(fill_value=0)

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 4))
df_grouped.plot(kind='bar', stacked=True, ax=ax)

ax.set_xlabel('Year')
ax.set_ylabel('Count of Address Changes')
ax.set_title('Distribution of Address Changes Over Time by Type')

plt.suptitle('')
ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(mdates.YearLocator())
plt.xticks(rotation=45, ha='right') 

plt.show()
0.addRule:
Don't use plt.xticks(ha) when not necessary. 
If you already dealt with the data format, don't need to use set_major_locator() again.

0.question: Give me the comparison about the sum of monthly_rental over the  date_address_from , and group by attribute other_details and bin date_address_from by year by a bar chart.
0.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv('./visEval_dataset/databases/behavior_monitoring/Student_Addresses.csv')
df['date_address_from'] = pd.to_datetime(df['date_address_from'])
df['year'] = df['date_address_from'].dt.year

grouped = df.groupby(['year', 'other_details'])['monthly_rental'].sum().unstack()

fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=(10, 4))
grouped.plot(kind='bar', ax=ax, width=0.7)

ax.set_xlabel('Year')
ax.set_ylabel('Total Monthly Rental')
fig.suptitle('')
ax.set_title('Comparison of Total Monthly Rental by Year and Property Type')

plt.show()
